page.title: 07 Rectory Farm (Mixed Farm)
page.content: Rectory Farm is part of the land owned by the Duchy of Lancaster - the Queen. The tenants rent the farm from the Duchy paying for the 230 acres it covers. The Duchy undertakes any repairs and improvements and the rent is adjusted accordingly; recently new land drainage was installed which increased the rent. The farm is mixed comprising about 100 sheep, 2 horses and crops of oil- seed rape, wheat and hay. To conserve grazing land sheep remain inside during the winter and are given fodder crops. The farm has 4 tractors, 1 baler, a combine harvester, hay tedder, plough and muck spreader. In May 1985 the Queen visited the area to inspect some of the Duchy farms.All her tenants were invited to a special luncheon with her.
